title: Zohaib Khan
text:
About Me
I’m a Research Assistant at the Lahore University of Management Sciences.
My goal is to be contribute towards democratizing and building efficient Machine Learning systems that empower underrepresented populations, and continuously improve upon existing technologies.
Some of my interests include (but are not limited to)

Efficient ML: Quantization, Pruning, Distillation, Neural Architecture Search, Parameter-Efficient Finetuning, TinyML
Multimodal Representation Learning: Visual Language Models, Diffusion Models, Text-to-Speech/Speech-to-Text Models
Natural Language Processing: LLMs for Code Understanding and Rewriting, LLM Agents, Multilingual NLP, NLP for underrepresented populations
Miscellaneous: Mixture of Experts, Model Merging, Parallel Computing, Open-Source Software, Automatic Differentiation Engines, Optimization

You can find a lot more details about my projects, relevant experiences (industry, research, and teaching), and activities outside academia in my CV.


Experience

Research Intern/Assistant - CSaLT at LUMS (Spring 2022 – Present)
Machine Learning Engineer - ISSM.ai (Summer 2023)
Deep Learning Intern - CodeSlash (Summer 2022 – Summer 2023)



Teaching

CS5302 Speech and Language Processing (LUMS Spring 2024) - Head TA
CS535 Machine Learning (LUMS Fall 2023) - Head TA
CS437 Deep Learning (LUMS Spring 2023) - TA



Miscellaneous

I enjoy Boxing and BJJ (I was Captain of the Boxing Team at LUMS for two years).
I drink an unhealthy amount of black coffee.
My favorite movie is Good Will Hunting.
I have five beautiful dogs.
I know how to quit Vim.

title: Welcome!
text:
Welcome!
I’m documenting parts of my learning journey through this blog. If I can’t code it, I don’t understand it.
If you want to learn more about me, visit the About Page. If you’re looking for something to read, check out my latest blog posts.
